main event: Three groups of four unidentified flying objects were observed by multiple witnesses in the Toms River, New Jersey area on January 6, 1954.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be circling, falling off, and moving in a random pattern.
The objects were described as light-colored, brilliant, and higher in altitude than two airplanes that were also observed.
Several prominent citizens of the Toms River area reported seeing the objects, including a police officer with an Air Force background.
One witness, a pilot who lived near Toms River, observed 12 objects flying in a left-hand circle formation at an estimated speed of 2,000-3,000 mph.
The objects were described as frightening and awesome by the witnesses, who did not want to see them again.
sighted object: Three groups of four unidentified flying objects
witnesses: Multiple witnesses, including a farmer, police officer, and pilot
photographs: No, the report does not mention any photographs
